frame.name: Judgment_direct_address
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, a <fen>Communicator</fen> judges the <fen>Addressee</fen> and then communicates that appraisal directly to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. The judgment is given for a particular <fen>Reason</fen> or about a particular <fen>Topic</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Communicator">The principal</fex> <t>rebuked</t> <fex name="Addressee">the student</fex> <fex name="Reason">for cheating on the exam</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged. <ex><fex name="Communicator">The teacher</fex> <t>scolded</t> <fex name="Addressee">the children</fex> <fex name="Topic">about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form. <ex><fex name="Communicator">The principal</fex> <t>rebuked</t> <fex name="Addressee">the student</fex> <fex name="Reason">for cheating on the exam</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> is the severity of the judgment.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Depictive</fen> describes the state of the <fen>Communicator</fen> or <fen>Addressee</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Grounds
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Grounds</fen> describes the basis for the judgment.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the judgment is communicated.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is the method employed to communicate the judgment.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>We were scolded <fex name="Place">in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>She complimented me <fex name="Time">almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root>The laudable or reprimandable status held by the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>He <t>rebuked</t> them <fex name="Role">as heathens and blasphemers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex>Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his <t>jeering</t> <fex name="Expressor">smile</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: verwijt.n
lexUnit.definition: waarmee je laat merken dat je iemand iets kwalijk neemt

lexUnit.name: terechtwijzing.n
lexUnit.definition: op een fout, al of niet met suggesties voor verbetering

lexUnit.name: reprimande.n
lexUnit.definition: van het berispen van iemand, of van het berispt worden (mondeling of schriftelijk)
